meanings.sent1: The soldiers carried their arms into battle.

meanings.definition: The upper limbs of the body.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped her arms around her friend in a hug.
meanings.sent2: His arms were sore after lifting heavy boxes all day.
meanings.sent3: The octopus had eight arms to catch its prey.
meanings.sent4: The tree's branches reached out like arms to the sky.
meanings.sent5: The robot's mechanical arms moved with precision.

meanings.definition: A branch or division of a family or organization.
meanings.sent1: The Smith family welcomed a new member into their arms.
meanings.sent2: The marketing department is an important arm of the company.
meanings.sent3: The arms of the organization reached out to help those in need.
meanings.sent4: The political party's extremist arm caused controversy.
meanings.sent5: The arms of the business expanded into new territories.

meanings.definition: To supply or equip with weapons.
meanings.sent1: The rebels armed themselves for the uprising.
meanings.sent2: The general decided to arm the troops with better gear.
meanings.sent3: She armed herself with knowledge before the exam.
meanings.sent4: The superhero armed himself with gadgets to fight crime.
meanings.sent5: The knight armed himself for the jousting tournament.
